story.storykicker: For the benefit of those from Gujarati origins, the state government has taken a decision to scrap 15 per cent of NRI admission seats
story.storybody:
As per new rules under the admissions in the NRI quota in colleges of Gujarat, students applying in the category are expected to have completed their class 12 from a school in the state. An official disclosed this decision to the Admission Committee for Professional and Medical Education Courses.

(Read: Odisha girl, with meagre family background, tops OJEE despite all odds )

More about NRI admissions in the state:

  • The state government took a recent decision to scrap 15 per cent NRI seats for private medical schools
  • There is no NRI quota in state government colleges
  • The fee charged by NRI quota are extremely soaring, that too in foreign currency
  • NRI quota seats will now be merged with management quota seats, raising the management quota seats percentage to 25
  • Management quota seats will be available only for the local students, though
  • The NRI students will also have to appear for the National Eligibility cum Entrance test (NEET) for admissions in medical colleges

(Read: Boys outshine girls, claiming top three positions in Kerala medical entrance exams )

Why the decision:

  • The decision is to benefit NRI's of Gujarati origin who were not benefitted initially
  • About 30 percent of the seats in the NRI quota were taken by those settled abroad but not of Gujarati origin
  • There will now be 500 seats in the management quota of the 2000 available seats in Gujarat's self-financed colleges

Seats in Private and Government run colleges:

Private colleges: This year 75 per cent seats will be filled by students taking the GujCET and 25 per cent admissions will be given to management quota students, the one who have cleared NEET

Government Colleges: As many as 85 percent of seats, will be filled by students taking the GujCET, while the rest 15 per cent will be gained by the students from all over the country taking NEET

Click here for more updates on India Today Education
